title: Describe a job that is useful to the society
cueCards: How you know about this job
What types of people do this job
And explain why you think this job is useful to the society
questions: Do you think schools should provide career advice to students?
Who should receive a higher salary, young people or older people?
Do you think doctors should be well-paid?
What kind of jobs deserve a high salary?
What kind of jobs receive a low income?
What kind of jobs are well-paid in your country?

title: Describe a countryside that you have been to
cueCards: When and why you went there
And explain how you felt about it
questions: What are the differences between the city and the countryside?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of living in the countryside?
What kind of people would like to stay in the countryside?
Do people go to the countryside to travel or to live?
Do most people prefer to live in big cities or in the countryside?
Do people in your country like to go hiking?

title: Describe a time that something changed your life in good ways
cueCards: And explain how it changed your life in good ways
questions: What are the disadvantages when people keep making changes?
When things like getting married or moving home happen, what kinds of things would you consider?
Who can adapt better to changes, children or adults?
How do you adapt to changes in life?
Why do some people quit and change jobs?
Do you like new things or changes in life?

title: Describe an invention that is useful in your daily life
cueCards: Whether it is difficult or easy to use
And explain why it is useful
questions: Who should support and sponsor inventors, governments, or private companies?
Do all inventions bring benefits to our world?
Are there any other inventions that make the world better?
What inventions do you think should be improved?
Do you think only scientists can invent new things?
What qualities do inventors have?

title: Describe a time when someone asked for your opinion
cueCards: Why he/she wanted to know your opinion
And explain how you felt when he/she asked for your opinion
questions: What should a company do when receiving feedback about its products?
Should teachers give advice to children?
What are the disadvantages of sharing opinions on the Internet?
Why do people like to express their opinions on the Internet nowadays?
Are there any apps designed for collecting opinions about products or services?
Why do some people dislike giving their opinions?

title: Describe a difficult decision that you made and had a good result
cueCards: Why it was difficult to make
And explain how you felt about the good result
questions: Do advertisements influence consumers' decisions?
Who do young people like to ask for advice when making decisions?
Do you think it’s necessary for kids to make as many decisions by themselves as they can?
Do you think some people can make decisions without asking for advice from others?
Do you think young people are easily influenced by others when they make decisions? Why or why not?
What kinds of decisions do young people have to make?

title: Describe a time you used your cellphone/smartphone to do something important
cueCards: And explain how you felt about the experience
questions: Do you think it is too late to call others at 11 or 12 o'clock at night?
What can be done to stop cellphone addiction?
Do you think there should be a law to stop people from making phone calls in public?
Which one is more important, using a cellphone to make phone calls or to read messages?
What are the differences between young people and old people when using a cellphone?
What do you usually do with a cellphone?

title: Describe a way/change that helps you save a lot of time
cueCards: And explain how you feel about the way/change
questions: What can schools do to help students learn time management?
Is it necessary for children to learn time management?
Do people who can manage time well become successful more easily?
Do you think parents should be responsible for teaching children to save time?
Does technology help people save time? How and why?
What can people do to save time?

title: Describe a friend you like to talk with
cueCards: What you like to talk about
Why you like to talk with him/her
And explain how you feel about him/her
questions: What are the differences between talking to a friend and talking to a stranger?
What makes a good listener?
On what occasions do people talk with strangers?
Do you think people should be honest when talking with friends?
What do young people talk about when they meet up?
Where do young people like to meet?

title: Describe a time when you were stuck in a traffic jam
cueCards: And explain how you felt in the traffic jam
questions: Would you rather be in a car or a bus in a traffic jam?
Do you like to use public transport?
What are good ways to manage traffic?
Do you think the high ways will help reduce traffic jams?
Do you think developing public transport can solve traffic jam problems?
How can we solve the traffic jam problem?

title: Describe an occasion when someone gave you positive advice or suggestions about your work/study
cueCards: And explain how you felt about the advice/suggestions
questions: Do you think people care about others’ comments about them?
Which is more important for adults in the workplace, positive feedback or negative feedback?
Why is negative feedback as important as positive feedback at work or in study?
Do you think negative feedback is more important than positive feedback? Why?
Should parents always encourage their children?
When should parents encourage their children?

title: Describe a popular/well-known person in your country
cueCards: And explain how you feel about this person
questions: Do you think popular children will grow up to be popular adults?
Are there any disadvantages if a child is popular at school?
What benefits are there when a child is popular at school?
Which one is more important, maintaining a good relationship with colleagues or doing well at work?
Are bosses more popular than employees at work?
What kinds of people are popular at work?

title: Describe a time you were very busy
cueCards: And explain why you were busy
questions: Does technology distract people?
How does technology help with time management?
What kind of pressure people may experience at work?
Do you think children should learn through playing games or under pressure?
What are the advantages and disadvantages when people keep busy？
Are you often busy？

title: Describe a traditional product in your country
cueCards: When you tried this product for the first time
And explain how you feel about it
questions: Where should children learn about culture, at school or at home?
Do you think people should be proud of their own culture? Why?
Why is it important for children to learn about traditional products?
What are some traditional Chinese products?
Do you think traditions are important for a country? Why?
Why are traditional products important?

title: Describe something you do that can help you concentrate on work/study
cueCards: And explain how you feel about it
questions: What can people do to improve their ability to concentrate?
Is it important for children to concentrate on their studies? Why?
Can exercise help people improve concentration?
What kinds of jobs require high concentration at work?
Do you think technology will harm children’s ability to concentrate?
Why is it more difficult for children to concentrate nowadays than in the past?

title: Describe a contest/competition you would like to participate in
cueCards: Where the contest/competition will take place
And explain why you would like to participate in it
questions: Do you think the ability to compete is natural or learned?
What kinds of people like to take part in competitions?
Do you think it is necessary to encourage people to compete with one another in companies?
What kinds of industries need competition? Why?
Why are competition shows popular?
What are the contests commonly seen on TV programs?

title: Describe a special day out that cost you little money/didn’t cost you much
cueCards: And explain how you feel about the day
questions: Going out to have holidays is tiring. Why do people still want to do it?
Why do people like to have days off?
Do you think only old people have time for leisure?
How does technology affect the way people spend their leisure time?
How do people spend their leisure time in your country?
Do people like to spend their leisure time out in your country?

title: Describe an occasion that you lost something
cueCards: When and where you lost it
What you did to find it
And explain how you felt about it
questions: What do people often feel after losing things?
What can we do to reduce the possibility of losing things?
What kinds of people may lose things often?
Is it effective to offer rewards to find lost things?
What will people do when losing things?
What kinds of things do people usually lose?

title: Describe something you do to keep fit and healthy
cueCards: Why it is important to keep fit and healthy
And explain why it can help you keep fit and healthy
questions: Should schools provide physical education to students? Why and how?
How can we use technology to keep fit?
Do you think it is good for governments to utilize popular celebrities to help build health awareness?
How can parents help and guide their kids to keep healthy?
What do people normally do to keep fit and healthy in your country?
How do children and old people keep fit and healthy?

title: Describe a family member who you want to work with in the future
cueCards: What kind of work you would like to do with him/her
And explain how you feel about this family member
questions: What do people need to do to change their jobs?
Why do people want to change their jobs?
What benefits are there when working for big companies?
Why do people want to have a family business?
Is it good to work with family members? Why?
What kinds of family businesses are common in China?

title: Describe something that surprised you and made you happy
cueCards: How you found out about it and what you did
And explain why it surprised you and made you happy
questions: What do people usually spend money on?
Do men and women have different attitudes and feelings about shopping?
Is it good for people to be unhappy? Why?
How can people be happy?
Do you think happiness has any effect on people? How?
How do people express happiness in your culture?

title: Describe a quiet place you like to go
cueCards: And explain how you feel about the place
questions: Why are there more noises made at home now than in the past?
Why do old people prefer to live in quiet places?
Do you think only old people have time for leisure?
How does technology affect the way people spend their leisure time?
How do people spend their leisure time in your country?
Is it easy to find quiet places in your country? Why?

title: Describe an interesting neighbor
cueCards: And explain why he/she is interesting
questions: How do people build relationships with local people in a new place?
Why do many people in big cities not know their neighbors?
Is it beneficial to get along well with neighbors?
How do children build relationships with others in a community?
How can people improve the relationship with neighbors in a community?
Do you think people are familiar with their neighbors?

title: Describe an important event you celebrated
cueCards: And explain how you felt about the event
questions: Do most people like to share their good news with others?
Why is it important to celebrate festivals?
Do people often celebrate festivals with families?
Do people often celebrate events with a large group of people or just a few people?
What kinds of events do people usually celebrate?
Do you like to celebrate important events? Why?

title: Describe an ambition that you haven't achieved
cueCards: What you are doing about it now
And how you feel about it
questions: What are the traits of ambitious people?
Why do some people like to be the manager in the workplace?
How do people balance work and life?
Why don't some people have dreams?
Why are some people very ambitious in their work?
What ambitions do children usually have?

title: Describe a time when you organized a happy event successfully
cueCards: Who helped you to organize it
And explain why you think it was a successful event
questions: Do you prefer to prepare and organize an activity or just take part in an activity?
How would you feel when you were not well prepared for something?
Do people need others’ help when organizing things?
Does everything need to be well prepared?
On what occasions do people need to be organized?
How can parents help children to be organized?

title: Describe a skill that you learned from older people
cueCards: And how you feel about it
questions: Do you think many old people in your country feel lonely?
What new skills can old people learn?
What knowledge can children learn from their grandparents?
What skills can young people learn from older people?
What kind of help do you think older people need?
What can children learn from their parents?

title: Describe a long walk you ever had
cueCards: And explain how you felt about this long walk
questions: Do you think that walking is not as helpful as playing other sports for our health?
What are the benefits of outdoor activities for children?
Do women have more leisure time than men?
Is leisure time important to everyone? Why?
What are the differences between the outdoor activities children did in the past and now?
What outdoor activities do people like?

title: Describe something that you can’t live without (not a computer/phone)
cueCards: How it helps you in your life
And explain why you can’t live without it
questions: Do you think it is good for a child to always take his or her favourite toy with them all the time?
Why do all children like toys?
What do you think influences people to buy new things?
Is the way people buy things affected? How?
Why do some grown-ups hate to throw out old things (such as clothes)?
Why are children attracted to new things (such as electronics)?

title: Describe a person you only met once recently and want to know more about
cueCards: Why you want to know more about him/her
And explain how you feel about him/her
questions: What should we not talk about when we meet a person for the first time?
What can we do to leave a good impression on people we meet for the first time?
What qualities make true friends?
Is it important to have the same hobbies and interests when making friends?
On what occasions do people like to make friends?
How do people make friends in China?

title: Describe a course that impressed you a lot
cueCards: What you did during the course
And explain why it impressed you a lot
questions: What can we learn from history?
What do people need to remember in their daily lives?
Can technology help people remember things better? How?
Which can help people remember things better, words or photos?
Do people like things of memorial significance?
Why do some people have a better memory than others?

title: Describe something that was broken in your home and then repaired
cueCards: And how you felt about it
questions: What kinds of things are easily repaired?
Do you think luxury products are of better quality?
Why do people like to get their mobile phones repaired in specialized stores?
What kinds of things do people like to repair by themselves?
Is the quality of products worse than before?
Are IT-related jobs valued more by society?

title: Describe someone you really like to spend time with
cueCards: And explain why you like to spend time with him/her
questions: Do you think it is important for us to get along with different kinds of people?
Do you think it's important to spend some time alone?
Do you like talking with older people? Why?
Do people have time for themselves nowadays?
How do leaders get along with their subordinates?
What kinds of people are easy to get along with?

title: Describe a special cake you received from others
cueCards: Who you got the cake from
And explain why it’s a special cake
questions: What do you think of people using their mobile phones during a meal?
In your country, do people nowadays cook at home as frequently as people did in the past?
Do you think it’s good to communicate when eating with your family?
Why are some people willing to spend a lot of money on meals on special days?
Is there any food in your country that is eaten at special times or on special occasions?
What are the differences between special food in China and other countries?

title: Describe an interesting song
cueCards: And explain why you think it is interesting
questions: Are foreign songs popular in your country?
Do you like to watch music TV programs? Why?
What are the differences between live concert and online concert?
What kinds of people like traditional music?
What kinds of music do young people like?
Why are many music competitions popular in China?

title: Describe an interesting discussion you had with your friend
cueCards: What opinions you and your friend had
Why you think the discussion was interesting
And how you felt about it
questions: Why do some young people refuse to communicate with others?
Should parents consider their children's opinions on everything? Why?
In what industries do you think communication is a necessary skill?
Should parents require their kids to obey them?
Do children have strong opinions?
When do children normally form their own views?

title: Describe a thing you did to learn another language
cueCards: How it helped you learn the language
And how you felt about it
questions: Some people think that technology has made it unnecessary to learn languages. What do you think?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of learning a language?
What's the best way to learn a language?
Which is better, to study a language alone or to study it in a group? Why?
Do you think language learning is important? Why?
What difficulties do people face when learning a language?

title: Describe a person who you follow on social media
cueCards: What he/she posts on social media
And explain why you follow him/her on social media
questions: Do you think it is easy to make friends on social media?
Do you think people will read paper newspapers and books in the future? Why?
Are non-social media like television and newspapers still useful?
Do older people spend much time on social media?
Do older people and younger people use the same kinds of social media apps?
What can people do on social media?

title: Describe a rule you dislike and would like to change in the future
cueCards: And explain why you would like to change it
questions: Do you know anyone who has broken the law? How?
When is it okay to break the rules?
How are people punished when parking at a wrong spot?
What rules should children follow at home?
Are the rules at school good or bad? Why?
What are the rules students should follow at school?

title: Describe an item of clothing that someone gave you
cueCards: And explain why this person gave you the clothing
questions: What influences the way people dress in today's society?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of wearing a uniform at school?
Why do people from different countries wear different clothing?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of wearing uniforms at work and school?
Why do people dress casually in everyday life but dress formally at work?
Have you ever given clothes to others?

title: Describe a city that you think is very interesting
cueCards: And explain why you think it is very interesting
questions: Do you think the big cities in China today will become even larger in the future?
What are the benefits of urbanization?
Do you think well-developed tourism will have negative effects on local people?
Do most elderly people live in the city or in the countryside?
Why do some young people like to live in cities?
What advantages can tourism bring to a city?

title: Describe a time you visited a new place
cueCards: And explain how you feel about the place
questions: Why do many people enjoy visiting a new place?
Do you think it's important to get as much information as possible before going to a new place?
How do young and old people react differently to new things?
Why do some people want to go to college far away from home?
How do young children react when they go to school for the first time?
Which do you prefer, living in a city or only visiting it as a tourist?

title: Describe a story someone told you and you remember
cueCards: And how you feel about it
questions: Which do you think is better, paper books or e-books?
Will smart devices affect the relationship between children and parents?
Why do children like stories?
How do people tell stories to children?
How has technology changed storytelling?
Do young children like the same stories as older children?

title: Describe a gift you would like to buy for your friend
cueCards: How long you have known him/her
How you would choose a gift for him/her
And explain why you would choose that gift for him/her
questions: Are there any unlucky things that people should not buy as gifts in your country?
What do people usually consider when buying gifts?
Which do people give on traditional festivals, red envelopes or other kinds of gifts?
Will people feel happy when receiving an expensive gift?
Is it hard to choose a gift?
When do people normally send gifts to others?

title: Describe a toy you liked in your childhood
cueCards: What kind of toy it is
And how you felt about it
questions: What are the advantages and disadvantages of modern toys?
What's the difference between the toys boys play with and girls play with?
Do you think parents should buy more toys for their kids or spend more time with them?
What's the difference between the toys kids play now and those they played in the past?
Should advertising aimed at kids be prohibited?
How do advertisements influence children?

title: Describe an important river/lake in your country
cueCards: And explain why it is important
questions: Are rivers and lakes important to a country?
What are the popular water sports in your country?
Are rivers and lakes good for transport? Why?
How do rivers and lakes affect local tourism?
Do you think rivers and lakes attract tourists?
How can rivers and lakes benefit local people?

title: Describe an old person you know who has had an interesting life
cueCards: What he/she has done in his/her life
And explain how you feel about him/her
questions: Do you think old people's life will improve with the development of technology?
Do old people prefer to stay at home or go outside? Why?
What are the benefits of elderly people living alone?
Can old people and their grandchildren learn from each other when they live together?
Why do some people live with old people?
What do old people often do in their daily lives?

title: Describe a time when you received good service in a shop/store
cueCards: When you went to the shop
What service you received from the staff
And explain how you felt about the service
questions: Can consumption drive economic growth?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of shopping online?
What are the differences between online shopping and in-store shopping?
Why do some people not like shopping in small shops?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of shopping in small shops?
Why are shopping malls so popular in China?

title: Describe a cultural place that you would like to learn the culture there (e.g. a library, museum, theatre)
cueCards: And explain how the place is related to culture
questions: Does the culture of the past have an impact on today’s culture?
Which is more important in terms of culture, literature or music?
How do young people learn about different cultures?
What kind of culture is popular among young people?
How is a culture formed?
How does the internet affect culture?

title: Describe a public park or garden
cueCards: And explain how you feel about it
questions: How can we encourage young people to go to parks more often?
What tourist attractions are popular in China?
Why do people like to visit tourist attractions?
What are the differences between a garden and a natural area?
What facilities are needed in a park?
Is it necessary to have public parks in cities?

title: Describe a place in your hometown/city that is different from other places and that you enjoy visiting with your parents/friends
cueCards: Who you often go there with
And explain why you think it is different
questions: What factors attract people to go to visit other places other than their hometown?
Do you think it is necessary to visit the same place many times?
What do young people like to do in their leisure time?
What are the differences between the places young people like to go and the places old people like to go?
Where do people in your hometown like to go?
What are the differences between big cities and small cities?

title: Describe a person from whom others like to ask for advice
cueCards: Why people like to ask for his/her advice
What kind of advice he/she often gives
And explain how you feel about the person
questions: Are professional consultancy services expensive in your country?
Do you think the advice parents give their children is always good?
Why do some people like to ask others for advice on almost everything?
Do people often ask for advice from professional people, like a lawyer?
Who should people ask for advice on big issues, family members or friends?
Do you follow the advice of your family members?

title: Describe a place you know where people can see a lot of wildlife (e.g. animals, birds, insects)
cueCards: What kinds of wildlife people can see there
Whether people like to go there
And explain how you feel about it
questions: Which is the better way to see wildlife, watching documentaries or going into the wild?
What impacts does only seeing wild animals in zoos have on children's understanding of these animals?
Are there many wildlife documentaries produced in your country?
Are wild animals easy to spot in your country?
Should parents take their children to the zoo to see wild animals?
Why are most children interested in wild animals?

title: Describe someone else’s room you enjoy spending time in
cueCards: What you can do in it
And explain why you enjoy spending time there
questions: Do you think old people will be able to keep up with the pace of technology in 50 years?
Who likes to stay at home more, young people or old people?
What are the most enjoyable parts of having a meal together with your family?
Why do people often take gifts with them when they visit others' homes?
Do most people visit other people's houses during the Spring Festival?
Do you like to invite your friends to your home?

title: Describe a time when you answered a phone call from someone you didn’t know in a public place
cueCards: And explain how you felt about the experience
questions: Should people be banned from talking loudly in public places?
Is it acceptable to talk on the phone in public?
Should parents teach their children to behave well in public?
Why do some people not care about their actions in public?
What are the differences between sitting next to someone who talks on the phone and sitting next to people who talk to each other while traveling by train?
Do most people mind others talking on the phone in public places?

title: Describe your favourite food at a traditional festival or a special event in your country
cueCards: At which festival/event you eat it
And explain why you like it
questions: Is it bad behavior for people to look at their phones during a meal?
Why do people like to have a big meal at traditional festivals or big events?
Do most people prefer vegetables bought from the supermarket or grown at home?
Are there any difficulties when people grow plants in cities?
What plants can people grow in cities?
Do people in your country grow plants at home?

title: Describe a person you know who has chosen a career in the medical field (e.g. a doctor, a nurse)
cueCards: And explain how you feel about him/her
questions: Can a hospital function effectively without nurses?
What are the differences between the work of a doctor and a nurse?
Do you think it is necessary to learn first aid skills?
Do you think that doctors and nurses are not paid enough?
Who plays a more important role, doctors or nurses?
Do you think doctors and nurses are very important?

title: Describe a person who likes to make things by hand (e.g. toys, furniture)
cueCards: Why he/she likes to make things by hand
And explain how you feel about the person
questions: How does modern technology change the handicraft industry?
Is it reasonable to charge a high price for handmade things?
Are there any traditional handicrafts in your hometown?
Why do many children like to make things by hand?
What are the benefits for students to learn to make things by hand?
Are traditional handicrafts important to tourism?

title: Describe a person who likes to read a lot
cueCards: And explain why you think he/she likes to read a lot
questions: Do you think people of all ages need to read?
What are the differences between paper books and movies?
What reading topics are popular in your country?
Is reading for fun or for work?
Do you think parents should help their children develop the reading habit from an early age?
Why are many people so keen on reading?

title: Describe a movie you watched and enjoyed recently
cueCards: When and where you watched it
And explain why you watched this movie
questions: Why do people prefer to watch movies in the cinema?
Do you think successful movies should have well-known actors or actresses in leading roles?
Do you think only well-known directors can create the best movies?
Do Chinese people prefer to watch domestic movies or foreign movies?
What are the factors that make a successful movie?
What kinds of movies do you think are successful in your country?

title: Describe a time when you lost an important and valuable item
cueCards: How important and valuable it was
And explain how you felt about the experience
questions: Is it important for students to be organized?
Are there any good ways to remind us not to forget or lose things?
What should parents do to teach their children not to lose things?
What do people often do after losing things?
What are the reasons why people often misplace or lose things?
What are some common items that people tend to lose easily?

title: Describe an occasion when you helped a family member/relative with something
cueCards: And explain how you felt about the experience
questions: How do people know that their neighbours might need help?
Do neighbours often help each other in your country?
Should parents reward their children when they help others?
What can children learn by helping others?
Should parents always help their children with everything?
How can children help their parents at home?

title: Describe a crowded place you went to
cueCards: And how you felt about it
questions: Do you think it is a good trend to have more big cities?
Do you think there are some people who enjoy crowded places?
Why do people go to crowded places?
Will people use bikes more or less in cities in the future?
Will there be more or less green space in cities in the future?
Which cities are overcrowded in your country?

title: Describe a challenge you faced that you thought was rather difficult
cueCards: When and where you faced it
Why you thought it was a difficult challenge
And explain how you felt at the time
questions: Why do some people enjoy doing extreme sports?
What challenges would people face when learning new sports?
What activities do you think would make children feel challenged? Why?
Do most people choose to face a challenge alone or with others?
Is it easy for children to overcome a challenge?
What do children often do when they face a challenge?

title: Describe an ideal and perfect place where you would like to stay (e.g. a house, an apartment)
cueCards: What special features it would have
Whether it would be big or small
And explain why it would be an ideal place for you
questions: What do you think buildings will be like in the future?
Why do some people choose to live in the city center?
Do different people have different preferences for houses or apartments?
What would people normally consider when they rent or buy a house or an apartment?
Why are apartments popular in some places while not in other places?
What are apartments like in your country?

title: Describe a person who has strong opinions
cueCards: What kinds of strong opinions this person has
And explain why you think he/she is a person who has strong opinions
questions: Do you think it is good to have strong opinions?
Do you think we should only say something after thinking it through?
Which is more important, listening to others or persuading others?
Are there many young people who have strong opinions in our lives?
What do old people have strong opinions about?
What do young people have strong opinions about?

title: Describe an old friend you had lost touch with and got in contact with again
cueCards: How you got in contact again
And explain how you felt after getting in contact again
questions: Why do we have to give up some old friends?
Why do people need to make new friends?
Why do old friends lose touch with each other?
Do you think you are good at maintaining good relationships with others?
Would having just a few friends limit your horizons?
Is it better to have a lot of friends than just a few friends?

title: Describe something you did in your study/work that has made you feel confident
cueCards: Why it made you feel confident
And explain how you felt about it
questions: Why do so many people lack confidence these days?
Do you think that children of confident parents are also confident?
What can teachers do to make studying more interesting?
How can teachers help their students become more confident by rewarding them for studying?
What can teachers do to help their students become more confident?
How can a person become more confident?

title: Describe a prize you have received recently (e.g. money, something valuable, a medal)
cueCards: What you did to receive it
And explain how you felt about it
questions: Why do some companies encourage employees to compete with each other?
Why do many companies offer prizes to their customers?
What criteria should be set for students to win a particular prize?
What prizes should schools set for students?
Why should we set prizes for competitions?
Do you think competition is all about the prize?

title: Describe an online video in which you learned something new
cueCards: When and where you watched it
And explain what you have learned from it
questions: Do you think online learning will replace face-to-face learning?
What are the advantages of online learning?
Why are so many young people obsessed with short videos?
Do you think people spend too much time watching short videos? Why?
Are there many people who watch online videos a lot?
What kinds of videos are most popular in your country?

title: Describe a time when you helped a child
cueCards: And how you felt about it

Why is it important to help neighbors?
Do people in your country like to help neighbors?
What can you do to help your neighbors?
What can schools do to develop students’ awareness of volunteering?

title: Describe something you received for free
cueCards: And how you felt about it
questions: What kinds of free services should be provided by the government?
Will people be happy when they receive free things?

Why should everyone have access to basic healthcare?
Why do customers like to receive free gifts from companies?
Is it good or bad for people to have a free education in the future?

title: Describe a person who contributes to the society
cueCards: What type of work he/she does
And explain why you think he/she contributes to the society
questions: What kinds of jobs are not paid fairly?
What skills should be taught at school to improve students’ ability to find jobs?
Do you think younger people should be lower paid than older people?
What are the impacts of the epidemic on the work environment?
What are the changes in working conditions?
What jobs are well-paid?

title: Describe a time that you showed something which was new to a person who was younger than you
cueCards: And explain how you felt about it
questions: Is it possible for a person to achieve something without motivation?

What skills do you think children should learn before going to school?
Why are some people not willing to ask help from others while studying?
What are the differences between the things adults learn and the things that children learn?
What skills should children learn?

title: Describe an enjoyable journey by public transport
cueCards: And how you felt about it
questions: What are the difficulties that commuters face during rush hours?
What do you think are the cheapest and most expensive means of transport?
What are the disadvantages of traveling by public transport?
Do you think offering free public transport will solve traffic problems in the city?
Why do more and more people like to travel by plane?
Why do people choose to travel by public transport?

title: Describe a sport you watched and would like to try
cueCards: When and where you watched it
Whether you will do it in the future
And explain how you felt about it
questions: Do you think sportsmen would use the sports gears promoted in the commercials?
Many advertisers like to use sports stars endorsements. What do you think are the reasons?
Do you think that international sports games are for money?
Why do so many people like to watch sports games?
What kinds of sports games do young and old people like to watch in your country?
Why do many people like to buy expensive sportswear for playing ball games?

title: Describe a place (city/town) that is good for people to live in
cueCards: And explain why it is better than other places to live in
questions: How different is life in the countryside to life in the city?
What are the major changes that have happened in your city?
What factors will contribute to whether a place is good to live in or not?
What are the differences between big cities and small ones?
What has happened to towns and villages in recent years in your country?
What are the differences between cities and towns?

title: Describe someone you know who made a good decision recently
cueCards: Why it was a good decision
And explain how you felt about the decision
questions: How should parents help their children make decisions?
Should parents interfere in children's decision-making?

At what age do you think children can be allowed to make decisions by themselves?
Do you think parents are the best people to make decisions about their children's education?
Should parents make decisions for their children?

title: Describe a special meal that someone made for you
cueCards: What and why he/she cooked for you
And explain how you felt about the meal
questions: What do you think about vegetarians?
Are there any people who wouldn't eat meat for their whole lives?

Do people in your country like to learn to cook from TV programmes?
Do you think people's eating habits would change as they get older?
Should students learn to cook at school?

title: Describe someone (a famous person) that is a role model for young people

questions: Do people tend to choose the best people as their role model?

Are there any differences between today’s famous people and those of the past?
Is it important for children to have a role model?
What kinds of people are likely to be the role models for teenagers?

title: Describe an interesting place you have been to with a friend

And explain why you think it is interesting

title: Describe a natural place (e.g. parks, mountains)

title: Describe a tourist attraction that very few people visit but you think is interesting

questions: Should all tourist attractions be free to the public?

title: Describe an indoor or outdoor place where it is easy for you to study

Do you prefer to study at home or study in other places?

title: Describe something you own that you want to replace
